Description: Small cup-like vase of black-top Nile silt pottery, roughly made with flat base and flaring sides. The exterior is not slipped but has a blackened rim area and is burnished with short diagonal strokes. The interior is untreated.
Curator's comments: Shape most like Black-top B20 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric pottery. It is probable (but cannot now be confirmed with certainty) that Mr. Legge, the donor of this and other objects, which he presented to the Museum in 1910, received them from the excavations of Ayrton and Loat at Mahasna in 1908-9, not those of Garstang at the same place in 1900-1. Legge worked at nearby Abydos in the same year in which Ayrton and Loat worked in the Predynastic cemetery at Mahasna (see 'Egypt Exploration Fund Arch. Report, 1908-9', 2, 5 ff.).
